Reviews.Title: “not for vacations not a resort but very good for budget short stays”
Reviews.Author: oestepr
Reviews.Content: this hotel is within a hospital. if u arrive late u will be escort by security through EMERGENCY ROOM of Puerto Rico's main cardiovacular hopital. Parking spaces are limited to 5-6 an could be occupied leaving you to go for a private option... well after being warned of its down side. This hotel is not expesinve 3 person stay will be less than half than islva verde or old sna juan equivalent. room are clean and comfortable. baths are worn but still functional. not bad if on a budget. but remebr u are within a hospital. we stayed to go to a 2 day meeting so we only needed it to shower and catch some sleep. so it was perefect for vacations perhaps not

Reviews.Title: “save your money and get something better”
Reviews.Author: Melody S
Reviews.Content: this place is crazy, I could understand if you have family that is sick in the hospital but other than that it would be better and safer to just save money and get a place that's an HOTEL just an HOTEL without the hospital part.

Reviews.Title: “DO STAY HERE! AVOID”
Reviews.Author: bobbypink05
Reviews.Content: our 2nd visit to Puerto Rico in less than a year. was SO looking forward. we originally had reservations at The San Juan Beach House Hotel and do not go their either. terrible. so after 5 mins of being in our room we decided to find something else. so we ended up here thinking bc it was a franchises it has to be decent. wrong! inside a haunted, quiet, scary hospital. bathroom was tiny, small, smelly, and towels are nasty! my boyfriend and I slept with our eyes open, bed was nasty and not comfortable. also, room is ice cold and if u turn down a/c it gets humid. please do not stay here, save your money. I have no idea why hotels.com would even sell these rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Hotel for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: anayia06
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because Howard Johnson is a well known establishment. Little did we know when we booked our 4 days 3 night stay that this hotel is inside the Cardiovascular Center fourth floor! When we checking in at 3pm on that Wednesday afternnon we had no clue when walking through the lobby that this is a hospital, we did not realized it until we came back that night and the main entrance was locked and the security escorted us through the emergency room to get the elevator that lead us to the fourth floor. The room was nice and comfortable, but we started asking for answers and demand to speak to the manager of the hotel we were ignored. This hospital sole purpose is to accomadate family members of patient who reside within the hospital NOT for tutorist like myself who after a long time saving save enough to plan my dream vacation! They should not advertise their hotel with other hotels that are meant for vacationing it's real poor taste of them.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It Please”
Reviews.Author: vmb1_11
Reviews.Content: If its for just somewhere to chill and have a good shower ok fine. BUT! for special ocation Hells NO! Dont do it, My Wife Almost Divorced me cuz of this! please dont stay here or it can cost you your marrige! This aint no real HOWARD JOHNSON! this is BUM JOHNSON!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: sharpfits
Reviews.Content: I made a mistake when I reserved this hotel but turned out to be the best mistake ever. located in the city this hospital/hotel is a gem.Clean,quiet and affordable it made our stay in San Juan a pleasure, only a ten minute ride to old San Juan. I recommend this one to all. Thanks to all the personnel for the kind and efficient service. Angie and freinds

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FJDiaz
Reviews.Content: My wife was called for an interview at university of Puerto Rico's school of dental medicine and the faculty is located near this hotel; in terms of location and prices it was the best option for us. Even though it is located in the top floor of an hospital, you won't notice what's going on down there. The service is really good; the manager was very kind, giving us information about the places to visit and helping us to find the best opportunities to know the essence of Puerto Rico. They now have high speed wireless service and if you don't have a laptop or netbook, there is a computer in one of the management offices that you can use. The room was very nice and clean. There are a few places to eat in the surroundings. For the friendly service and cleanliness, I totally recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service makes a difference”
Reviews.Author: carlitosangulo
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to spend some days in Puerto Rico and are in a tight budget, this hotel is a great choice. However, you must know, this is not a regular hotel, it is located within a medical facility, because it is intended to be a hotel for patients who travel a long distance to receive medical care in the cardiovascular center in San Juan. For this reason, there is no swimming pool, nor other amenities. We didnt know this and were thinking of moving out after the first night, but after knowing the Hotel Manager and his team, we were very pleased. The service is great and they really do their best for making guests feel at home. The people at the hotel were very helpful and friendly, and provided us with a lot of tourist information which really helped us to get the most out of our stay and finding a couple of great deals in shopping here and there. However, if you have a bigger budget and want a more resort/beachclub like experience, this is not recommended for you, this is a great option for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: NYCFlorida
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Howard Johnson Centro Medico in San Juan. The hotel was everything we needed. I had a family member that was in an accident so we needed to be near the hospital. The hotel is located inside of the cardiac hospital on the 4th floor. This may not be ideal for vacationers but if you need to be near the hospital itâ€™s perfect. I would still stay at this hotel even on a vacation because the rates are good compared to other hotels in San Juan. The hotel is easily accessible as you can take mass transit or cab to Old San Juan near the port (mass transit is much cheaper) Less than five minutes away is a major mall with restaurants and a movie theater. There is a cafeteria on the first floor and the food is mostly good. A short walk away in the center of several hospitals is an Estrella (Spanish food), Burger King, Churches Chicken and a Subway. If I hadnâ€™t stayed here I would be skeptical but since I did I know that the rooms are clean and the staff is courteous. They go out of their way to make a difference in your stay. Upon arrival the manager gave us directions to get around. They offered to get ice for me since itâ€™s on a separate floor in the hospital but I was fine getting it. My mother didnâ€™t realize that when her medications were picked up at the drug store prior to her departure to Puerto Rico that she didnâ€™t get one medication filled that she needed. Glory a staff member called the local CVS explained everything so they could have the prescription transferred over from the CVS where we live. This is just one of the many things that the manager Mr. Gonzalez and his staff did for us. The staff made a bad situation a lot better. We ended up staying about 3 weeks. If you are looking for a safe, clean place with a great staff this is it.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: JHunter26
Reviews.Content: After reviewing many options, I selected to stay at this hotel because it was the cheapest in the area and seemed of good quality. I figured I wouldn't be in the room that much so what does it matter? For starters, it's located on the 4th floor of an unmarked building on a huge college-like campus. I arrived on a Friday afternoon right at rush hour and there were lots of medical staff in white coats and students leaving all at once, which created a huge traffic jam. Secondly, no one seems to know where the hotel is. The guy at the rental place told me there's no Howard Johnson in this area when I asked him. When I finally found my way to the campus, I had to pull over and ask a security guard who was directing traffic. He didn't speak English. I parked illegally and ran inside a building to ask someone. I found a woman who spoke English. She pointed to a door and said take the elevator up. No one could tell me where to park the car! I drove around and found the visitor garage where you have to pay. This is a good 8-10 minute walk from the building the hotel is in so I wheeled my luggage from my rental in the garage along the sidewalk while dodging medical students and cars. Mind you, it was 86 degrees and humid and I hadn't had a chance to change since I got off the plane. I was still wearing jeans and a long sleeve shirt. I went through the door that was pointed out to me and took the elevator up to the 4th floor. Finally! I found it. The elevator opens right up onto the front desk. I checked in and asked about parking. The free hotel parking that is advertised on various websites amounts to 6 spaces. That's right, SIX! Even better is the fact that they're located just outside the building and in the back where the maintenance workers and hotel staff park... on a downward slope... in single file. You must be good at parallel parking or else it's the visitor's garage for you! Keep in mind that family members who are visiting relatives in the hospital and are staying at this hotel are competing for these spaces as well. Parking was rarely available throughout my weeklong stay. Another afternoon I was heading back up to my room after a nice day out and the elevator stopped on the 2nd floor. A patient on a gurney was wheeled in with a couple of doctors, which was uncomfortable for the both of us I'm sure. It only served as a reminder that I'm staying at a hospital hotel. I took a cab into San Juan a few times because drivers in Puerto Rico are ridiculous and I was tired of having to search for parking after every outing. Be prepared to tell cab drivers where this place is because they won't have a clue. The drivers were always surprised when I told them there was a hotel here and once on campus, I had to direct them where to drop me off. Lastly, the campus is surrounded by one of the worst GHETTOS I've ever seen. I ventured about 50 feet outside of an entrance and didn't feel comfortable going any further. There's a lot of construction going on, graffiti, bums, trash, beggars, etc. I did feel safe within the campus area. The rooms were OK. Pretty basic and to use the Internet you either have to sit in one of the chairs next to the reception desk for wireless or request an ethernet cable so you can use it in your room. To the staff's credit, they were nice. It was depressing having to return to this place after a nice day out. I was about the only tourist staying at this place and I kept wondering if the hotel staff thought I was crazy for staying here because it's usually booked with Puerto Ricans visiting the hospital. I would not recommend it and recommend staying anywhere else. STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, affordable with good central location”
Reviews.Author: veganjohn
Reviews.Content: If you're in San Juan doing business or shopping downtown, or with the hospital or university and don't need or want to be near the beaches, then this hotel is a great choice. It's very affordable, clean, quiet and comfortable. It is located on the fourth floor of a hospital, but it has a separate entrance and the hospital is quiet. I heard very few ambulances outside and no noise inside. One nice thing about being in a hospital is that there is unlimited hot water which is great for someone like me who likes to take long showers. You should have a car or someone to give you rides as it is away from public transit and there is a lot of construction going on in the surrounding area, making for rather awkward walking.

Reviews.Title: “LAST, LAST, LAST Resort”
Reviews.Author: jedkara
Reviews.Content: First off, know that we are not frequent OR picky travelers. We like things clean and simple. Now, DO NOT stay here unless you HAVE to. I'm not sure it's clear from the ad because it's so unbelievable but this "hotel" is literally on the 4th floor of a working hospital. Read that again. It's not a converted hospital, not a revamped hospital, an actual functioning hospital. The lobby is a junky hospital lobby, the elevators are junky hospital elevators (the main one wasn't working when we were there), and the decor is, well...hospital...use your imagination. The room is more or less clean, other than various hairs all over the place, but, you guessed it, is smells like a hospital! The big attractions - hi speed internet in each room - is a farce (it works with an ethernet cable, so they say, but they didn't have any). And HERE'S THE WORST PART - it's located in a part of town where there is nothing to eat, other than the HOSPITAL cafeteria - and it's a $20 cab ride to Old San Juan. So, at $114/night with taxes (for a 2-person room), plus the $20 cab ride each way you'll need to get fed, I think you can do better. Stay only if it your last, last, last resort.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: RelaxnenjoyMontreal
Reviews.Content: Part of a Medical Center, 20 min. from the airport and 20 min. to Cruise Port. Room was not that cleaned. Needed a paint job and the air trap was very dirty. Very surprising considering that it's part of an Hospital ! Look at the picture...
